event_text: m_c is caught breaking the Warrior Code.
m_c went missing for a few days.
m_c believes {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} part of a new prophecy.
m_c believes {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'{VERB/m_c/re/s} meant for something greater.
m_c tries to convince r_c to run away with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c is caught outside of the Troop's territory.
r_c gives m_c something to adorn {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt as congratulations.
m_c decides to pick something to adorn {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt as celebration.
m_c found a mysterious acc_singular growing in the frost and decided to wear it.
m_c received a present, acc_plural, from r_c and decided to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c was given acc_plural as a congratulations. r_c watched from the side with a jealous glint in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes.
m_c always seems to have acc_plural stuck in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur.
m_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to keep them.
r_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to give them to m_c.
m_c found a dessicated leech that somehow got into the camp. It still wasn't edible... not that m_c double-checked or anything, of course.
m_c misstepped and slipped from a rock, but landed on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} feet nimbly, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Troopmates commenting on the show of dexterity.
m_c wasn't looking where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} going and tripped over some rubble, but came out of it with only {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pride bruised.
m_c was trying to fluff up {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw a metal shard inside of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} bedding. Another prank, but it could not fool {PRONOUN/m_c/object}!
m_c gathered up the cubs to tell them stories of story_list.
m_c spends the evening regaling the Troop with stories of story_list.
m_c and r_c start throwing unpopped bubble fruit at each other while on guard duty, eventually getting the whole Troop to join in.
The tension between c_n and o_c is palpable, with even the smallest actions potentially leading to violence.
The war with o_c is beginning to disrupt the daily lives of c_n, forcing them to adapt to new routines and living situations in order to better defend themselves.
m_c and r_c watch the Clan's cubs play and daydream about having their own one day.
m_c watches r_c give an elder the juiciest piece of food in the store. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/feel/feels} lucky to have such a kind person as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} mate.
m_c watches r_c give an elder the juiciest piece of food in the store. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/feel/feels} lucky to have such a kind person as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} mate.
m_c sits still as r_c helps remove some indistinct gunk that got stuck in m_c's spines.
m_c listens bashfully as r_c tells the story of how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} fell in love with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate to a group of starry-eyed cubs.
m_c and r_c are so cuddled up and cozy in their nest they almost miss the dawn patrol.
r_c gives m_c the prettiest fallen leaf {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can find. m_c wears it with pride.
m_c and r_c spend the evening chasing dragonflies around camp. m_c keeps a trophy of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} catch on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
It's tough working in such extreme heat. m_c and r_c spend their evening relaxing together and cooling down in the shade.
m_c calls out to some eager cubs, and after they have situated themselves in front of m_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/start/starts} telling the cubs a thrilling story of times long past.
The older cats look fondly upon the cubs who are dashing in and out of leaf piles at the edge of camp.
m_c went for a long walk this morning, deep in thought.
The world around {PRONOUN/m_c/object} feels smaller lately; m_c looks out at the horizon and yearns for something unnameable.
m_c considers, as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/look/looks} out over the Clan, if perhaps this isn't where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/belong/belongs}.
m_c's dreams are filled with flashbangs and blood-scent. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wake/wakes} up screaming.
m_c thought {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw a familar wispy form lingering at the edge of camp, but the ghost disappeared before {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} could be sure.

r_c overheard m_c muttering in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sleep, hands clenching at the air. {PRONOUN/m_c/poss/CAP} muttering confirms what r_c always suspected -  m_c was the one responsible for mur_c's death.
m_c can't keep this secret anymore. When {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/m_c/self} alone with r_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} tell the story of mur_c's death.
m_c laughs as r_c accuses {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of murdering mur_c. So what if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did? What is r_c going to do about it?

r_c gathers all the courage {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} and quietly tells m_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/know/knows} what {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did to mur_c. m_c glares and threatens r_c with the same fate if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} keep {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth shut.
r_c avoids m_c at all costs after accidentally witnessing mur_c's murder. r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can't keep it a secret but is terrified of what m_c might do.
m_c doesn't change expressions in the slightest when r_c accuses {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of murdering mur_c. Who cares?
m_c's cold eyes don't blink when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} accused of murdering mur_c, and only states that the Troop is better off without mur_c anyways.
m_c boldly confesses to the entire Troop that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} killed mur_c. m_c claims that mur_c deserved to pay for what {PRONOUN/mur_c/subject} did.
m_c is truthful when r_c questions {PRONOUN/m_c/object} about mur_c's strange death. m_c claims that mur_c deserved to die after what {PRONOUN/mur_c/subject} did to m_c.
r_c is stunned when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/discover/discovers} m_c carelessly bragging about killing mur_c to a wandering loner.
